aboutMe.headline: Hey, I'm Lisa!
bullets: Strong focus on clinical application of diagnostic, preventive and therapeutic approaches
Molecular biologist with expertise in exosome research, oncology and translational science
Open-minded, highly motivated and pro-active personality
Enjoys working in inter-disciplinary teams on challenging projects

items.jobSpecification: Project manager/Scientist: Translational Research & Personalized Medicine
descriptions: Portfolio management of translational research projects: scientific and administrative coordination and implementation (e.g. review process, budget planing and control, project monitoring)
Development and execution of scientific concepts for personalized medicine

items.company: Technical University of Munich / Helmholtz Zentrum München
descriptions: Scientist at the Institute of Radiation Biology (Helmholtz Center Munich) and PhD student (Dr. rer. nat.) at the Department of Medicine (TUM)
Field of studies: Functional analysis of head and neck cancer exosomes released in response to ionizing radiation
Enrolled at Helmholtz Graduate School (HELENA), TUM Graduate School and Helmholtz Research School of Radiation Biology (RS2)
Supervision of practical courses and master students
Topic of Master’s Thesis: ‘Characterization of extracellular microRNAs after irradiation of HNSCC cell lines’
Topic of Bachelor’s Thesis: ‘Impact of the EGF-Receptor on the cellular answer to DNA-damage’

items.titel: Radiation alters the cargo of exosomes released from squamous head and neck cancer cells to promote migration of recipient cells

items.titel: Quantitative changes in the protein and miRNA cargo of plasma exosome-like vesicles after exposure to ionizing radiation
